column2: Warhammer RETROSPECTIVES - Four decades of change!
The HORUS HERESY Retrospective: From 1988 to Now
column7:
The Horus Heresy is a central element of Warhammer 40,000 - the mythological history for the whole setting. But it wasn't ever part of the original game - it was a later addition. In this video, we go through the original story, it's appearances over the years, and how it evolved over time into the full setting it is today.

column2: THE BADAB WAR: Retrospective, from 80s White Dwarf to 00s Imperial Armour - 40k Archives
column7:
The Badab War is one of the most interesting bits of background in the Warhammer 40,000 universe - a Space Marine civil war invented early in the days of Rogue Trader and then returned to again and again by Games Workshop and Forge World, and a direct predecessor to the Horus Heresy series.

In this video, we go through the original story, it's appearances over the years, and how it has evolved over time.

column2: FIMIR: What happened to Warhammer's unique fantasy species? - WH Archives
column7:
Back in the 80s, Fimir were Warhammer Fantasy's 'unique' fantasy race - lizardlike monsters from the marshes and fens. But production and background issues mean they were never that popular, and Games Workshop shelved them for two decades. In this video, we look back through the history of Fimir in the game.

column2: SQUATS: Whatever happened to Space Dwarves in Warhammer 40k? - 40k Archives
column7:
Let's look at the Squats - from their initial flurry of releases in the late 80s until their surprising return to the world in Necromunda, we chart the story of the stunty little space dwarf bikers through the history of Warhammer 40,000.

column2: ADEPTUS ARBITES: Warhammer 40k's Space Police, History & Retrospective - 40k Archives
column7:
I EM THE LERR! The Imperium's space police - the Adeptus Arbites - have changed a lot over the history of 40k. Let's look at how the Arbitrators got started, way back in Games Workshop's Judge Dredd game, and what they became as the Warhammer 40,000 universe expanded.

column2: How did we get ADEPTUS CUSTODES in WARHAMMER 40k? | Faction Retrospective
column7:
Custodes were originally little more than a footnote in the first edition of Warhammer 40k - how did they end up as a major faction with a complete plastic range? Well, it has something to do with third-party manufacturers....
